PECO
September 16, 2019 at 12:05 PM ·

On Friday, September 13, 2019, PECO held its first annual Energy Force graduation ceremony to recognize three individuals; Andrea Tumax from ASPIRA, Inc. of Pennsylvania, Lizzie Smith from Special Olympics Pennsylvania, and Lior Liebling from Judith Creed Horizons for Achieving Independence - JCHAI for their work in the 2018-2019 program.

PECO Energy Force is a program that partners with local non-profit organizations (501c3) to train adults with developmental disabilities to serve as Ambassadors for PECO’s Energy Efficiency programs. Ambassadors receive training and resources that help them to create fun, interactive demonstrations that deliver important energy-efficiency tips to their peers and PECO customers, spreading key messages about the benefits of energy efficiency and conservation at home.

To learn more about PECO Energy Force, visit peco.com/energyforce.

A group of artistic #StetsonCharter students recently showed their printmaking work during their opening exhibit at Woodmere Art Museum, attended by educators, fellow students and families who turned out to see the results of their hard work.

The "Ten by Ten" theme refers to the ten-year anniversary of Prints Link Philadelphia, a special group who helped make this exhibit possible as well as the ten different printmaking processes taught to students by Prints Link Teachers.

Our students are sharing this wall with other talented young artists from Esperanza: Strengthening Hispanic Communities. We owe special thank you's to Woodmere Art Museum and Prints Link Philadelphia for this fantastic opportunity and their continued support of #PHLedArts.

post_text: Christopher Javier graduated John B. Stetson Charter School in 2014. He is now a senior at Constitution High School where he holds down a 3.8 GPA. His greatest accomplishments, however, are on the baseball field. He was invited this summer to go to the Dominican Republic to represent the USA at the Latin American Baseball Classic, in and of itself an incredible accomplishment. He played in the 18 and under squad as the youngest and smallest player and won the MVP award along with best defense while hitting .692 against the top pitchers from around the world. He also participated in numerous tryouts for professional teams and received attention from major league baseball's Seattle Mariners. Keep it up Chris, you're making #ASPIRASchools proud ~

John B. Stetson Charter School students recently had the distinct honor of meeting Ms. Manya Frydman Perel, a Holocaust survivor, and hearing her story of survival. By the age of 17, she was confined to the Radom Ghetto before being deported to 8 concentration and death camps. Despite living in constant fear, Manya bravely risked her life to save others. She managed to escape a death march from Auschwitz just days before its liberation.

Manya expressed her love for the children sitting before her as they pledged to remember her story and carry on her legacy. “I hope that my life will be an example for others not to take life for granted, not to be prejudiced toward others, and to respect one another. After all, we only have one life to live.”

We are so grateful to Manya and Holocaust Awareness Museum and Education Center for making this powerful educational event possible.

View the full photo collection here: https://www.flickr.com/photos/aspirapa/albums/72157685100595156

Last month, Olney students performed a huge dance according to the cultural traditions of Puerto Rico, the Dominican Republic - and the Sebastian Festival / Taino peoples specifically. It was all possible thanks to our friends at Taller Puertorriqueño who taught students the dance while imparting loads of information about how to identify the powerful symbols, rhythms and styles of these influential peoples.

Thank you to all the staff members, artists and organizers who brought everyone together for this event. The volume coming from the auditorium said it all.

Stay up to date on the great things happening at Taller by subscribing to their mailing list: https://tallerpr.org/

¡ASPIRA Stakeholders se enorgullece en presentar la Feria de Salud Comunitaria en la escuela Antonia Pantoja Charter!

Este evento es posible gracias a la Asociación Latinoamericana de Estudiantes de Medicina, PHMC y ASPIRA Stakeholders. Las reuniones de ASPIRA Stakeholders son una excelente manera de ponerse en contacto con su comunidad local. La próxima reunión tendrá lugar el jueves, 16 de febrero a las 4:00 pm en la escuela Antonia Pantoja Charter en el 4101 N American St., Filadelfia, PA 19140. También estamos agradecidos por la participación y apoyo del Capitán Michael Cram del Distrito 25 de la Policía de Filadelfia.
